part.line: This is the Original English Scriptment of Project Yuki, The Videogame about—
This is a GPL-licensed, completely free script specially formatted for the purpose of designing a video game.
This script was lovingly hand-written in XML and CSS-formatted with beautiful fonts for your reading pleasure.
The style of the script is specially tailored to localization and interaction design.
The font sizes and styles are the same sizes and styles used for the actual in-game subtitling—
Subtitles? You mean, the reader might not understand me?
The reader might not understand French.
But she does understand the script language.
Voice languages, however, are shown through the use of the ISO-639 language codes located at the top left corner of each line of text.
part.narration: Kyle points to his language code.
part.line: Don't forget to tell the reader about the line identification numbers.
Each line of dialogue in a script file is given a [unique identification number], located next to the speaker_name.
Oh! Interactivity notes tell scene programmers about the special ways in which the narrative, camera techniques, and game design meld together to tell the game's story.
part.narration: Kyle apologizes to Chromium users.The first edition of the script navigator does not work with Google Chrome, due to a loading error. If the reader is using Firefox, give them a pat on the back — for now.
part.line: Let's get this show on the road.
